title: Lynn Fisher
author: Lynn Fisher
description: Lynn Fisher is a web designer, CSS developer, and artist from Phoenix, Arizona.
notes: Lynn has become well-known especially for her A Single Div project and stunning annual personal site redesigns. She consistently makes me question the limits of what's possible with the web.

title: Marco Rogers
author: Marco Rogers
notes: I started to follow Marco back when Twitter was actually good, as his perspective was insightful and authentically resonant. I'm sad that Twitter has been systematically dismantled, but glad to be able to read his perspective in long form all the same.

title: Bits about Money by Patrick McKenzie (patio11)
author: Patrick McKenzie
description: About the modern financial infrastructure that the world sits atop of.
notes: Is there anything Patrick writes or speaks on that isn't on point? Here, he shares insights topically scoped to the world of finance, pulling back the curtain on a world many don't normally get to see or understand.

title: Patio11's Greatest Hits
author: Patrick McKenzie
description: Patrick McKenzie's site where the vast majority of his blog content lives.
notes: Start with his Greatest Hits, but you really can't go wrong with much of anything Patrick writes.

title: Straight Talk for Hard Times
author: sadgrl
description: The mass layoffs, re-orgs, right-sizing and evolving impacts of AI are hitting the field of applied research in ways that have commonalities with other fields.
notes: Written for researchers, I think the content is just as relevant for technologists.
quote: How does the company make their money? This one is FAR more critical than I once realized; and it’s not about examining balance sheets or annual reports. It’s about understanding the core value of what a company does that enables it to exist.

title: Cat Hicks Resilient Productivity
author: Cat Hicks, PhD
description: Cat is a social scientist, data scientist and entrepreneur, and her nontraditional path shines in her work toward genuinely improving people's lives (especially those dealing with more than their share of adversity).
notes: Cat writes from a much needed intersection of social science, data/technology, and narrative.
